text:
Chromium: CVE-2023-5483 Inappropriate implementation in Intents 
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) for more information. 
Chromium: CVE-2023-5483 Inappropriate implementation in Intents 
On this page 
 
CVE-2023-5483 
Security Vulnerability 
Released: Oct 13, 2023  
Assigning CNA: 
Chrome 
CVE-2023-5483  
 
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see  
Google Chrome Releases 
 for more information. 
Why is this Chrome CVE included in the Security Update Guide? 
The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based).  It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable.  Please see  
Security Update Guide Supports CVEs Assigned by Industry Partners 
 for more information. 
How can I see the version of the browser? 
In your Microsoft Edge browser, click on the 3 dots (...) on the very right-hand side of the window

metadata.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-5483 Inappropriate implementation in Intents
metadata.description: This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) for more information.
metadata.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by CVE-2023-5483, an inappropriate implementation in Intents vulnerability assigned by Chrome. This vulnerability is in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. Attackers could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has addressed this vulnerability by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. System administrators are advised to ensure that their Microsoft Edge installations are updated to the latest version. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page. The vulnerability affects Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 118.0.2088.46, released on 13th October 2023. Microsoft has provided a security update to mitigate the risk of exploitation. No specific workaround or mitigation beyond updating to the latest version is mentioned.
metadata.nvd_description: inappropriate implementation in intents in google chrome prior to 118.0.5993.70 allowed a remote attacker to bypass content security policy via a crafted html page. (chromium security severity: medium)
